# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on Hyperfy development, with several key technical topics emerging. ToxSam inquired about building a clicker game, receiving code examples from MetaMike and Ashxn demonstrating UI interaction with onPointerDown events. Material property manipulation was discussed, with confirmation that only emission and UV scrolling can be modified at runtime. Ashxn shared several significant updates, including a new persistent storage system that enables saving data between sessions, which opens possibilities for timers, quests, GUIs, and action bars. There was technical discussion about bone animation manipulation, with developers expressing interest in the ability to override individual bone animations for more natural character movements like head-turning. The community also discussed issues with Claude 3.7 AI, noting decreased productivity compared to 3.5. A scrolling bug in the inspector pane was identified and quickly fixed by Ashxn. Community members are working on organizing and cataloging shared .hyp files for better accessibility, with projects like "hyperdex" and "hypdeck" being developed to store code snippets and examples.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is it possible to build a simple clicker game in Hyperfy? (asked by ToxSam) A: Yes, using onPointerDown events for interaction (answered by Ashxn and MetaMike)
Q: What material properties can be influenced at runtime? (asked by MetaMike) A: Only emission and UV scrolling can be modified at runtime (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is it possible to get the camera's current position and rotation? (asked by ~/HowiEDuhzit) A: Yes, but there was a bug where initial values were zeros; Ashxn fixed this (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can I list player IDs in the world? (asked by ~/HowiEDuhzit) A: Yes, this functionality is now available (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can we get a setBoneTransform() function? (asked by ~/HowiEDuhzit) A: Initially dismissed as niche but later recognized as valuable for animation blending and natural movements (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Does scale work yet in v2? (asked by bear) A: Yes, but for an App's Node you need to use app.root (answered by Saori and bear)

# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around 3D design topics for the Hyperfy platform. Key technical discussions include:

ii_cable_ii discussed lighting strategies for dark spaces in their project, noting they need directional shadows requiring multiple light sources but plan to use emissive glows for accent lighting. They're building connected maps with individual mini-skyboxes.

A significant conversation occurred around the Hyperfy Tools for Blender. When mrtzhckr asked about finding the tools (as the GitHub link wasn't working), maximus and HowiEDuhzit clarified that the tools are now available as an official Blender extension, installable directly through Blender's preferences panel.

HowiEDuhzit shared a floor asset with bear that includes an automatic script to snap it to the origin and straighten it. Ashxn later questioned whether Hyperfy Tools always nests everything in a LOD structure, suggesting this might be inefficient when only one LOD is present.

Other topics included sharing of impressive 3D design examples, a video about avoiding ACES tonemapping, and a mention of Blender animators winning an animated feature award.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Where can I find the Hyperfy Blender tools? (asked by mrtzhckr) A: You can find it inside Blender - open preferences, click extensions, and search for "hyperfy tools" (answered by HowiEDuhzit)
Q: Does Hyperfy Tools always nest everything in a LOD no matter what? (asked by Ashxn) A: Unanswered
